description: Shared type definitions for MLS (Message Layer Security) protocol

convoView.description: View of an MLS conversation with member and epoch information

groupId.description: MLS group identifier (hex-encoded) - canonical conversation ID

cipherSuite.description: MLS cipher suite used for this conversation

memberView.description: View of a conversation member representing a single device. Multiple devices per user appear as separate members in MLS layer, but UI should group by userDid.

did.description: Device-specific MLS DID (format: did:plc:user#device-uuid). Used in MLS operations.

userDid.description: User DID without device suffix (format: did:plc:user). Used for UI grouping and admin status sync.

deviceName.description: Human-readable device name (e.g., 'Josh's iPhone'). Optional, may be null for legacy members.

joinedAt.description: When this device joined the conversation

isAdmin.description: Whether this member (device) has admin privileges. Admin status is synced across all devices of the same user.

promotedAt.description: When member was promoted to admin (if applicable)

promotedBy.description: DID of admin who promoted this member (if applicable)

leafIndex.description: MLS leaf index in ratchet tree structure

messageView.description: View of an encrypted MLS message. Server follows 'dumb delivery service' model - sender identity must be derived by clients from decrypted MLS content for metadata privacy. Server GUARANTEES: (1) Sequential (epoch, seq) assignment per conversation, (2) Monotonic seq increment, (3) No seq reuse. Clients MUST process messages in (epoch ASC, seq ASC) order for correct MLS decryption.

epoch.description: MLS epoch when message was sent

seq.description: Monotonically increasing sequence number within conversation. Server assigns sequentially starting from 1. Gaps may occur when members are removed from the conversation, but seq values are never reused.

createdAt.description: Message creation timestamp (bucketed to 2-second intervals for traffic analysis protection)

messageType.description: Message type discriminator: 'app' for application messages (user content), 'commit' for MLS protocol control messages (epoch changes, membership updates). Clients should process both types for MLS state tracking but only display 'app' messages in the UI.

keyPackageRef.description: Reference to an MLS key package for adding members

keyPackageHash.description: Hex-encoded SHA-256 hash of the key package bytes. Clients should use this server-computed hash when creating conversations to ensure hash consistency.

cipherSuite.description: Supported cipher suite for this key package
